SECRET.
G.T.5377
BATTLE SITUATION - NOON - 11th August, 1918.
1. WESTERN FRONT. Violent fighting is still taking place on the battle front from MORLANCOURT - South of MONTDIDIER, and good progress is being made by the French in the South. North of the SOMME we have made an advance to the outskirts of BRAY-sur-SOMME. Immediately South of the SOMME the resistance is stiffening. The line now runs approximately. South to North, as follows:- MACHEMONT - 1 kilometre North-East of CHEVINCOURT - SAMSON - MAHEUIL - LAMOTTE - ROYE-sur-MATZ - BUS (French) - MARQUIVILLERS (German) - l'ECHELLE (German) - HLLERS-les-ROYE (German) - DAMERY (British)- PARVILLERS (German) - East of FOUQUESCOURT - railway line West of HALLU - LIHONS (German) - RAINECOURT (German) - PROYART (German) - East of MERICOURT - East of ETINEHEM - West of BRAY-sur-SOMME - Western outskirts of MEAULTE.
The prisoners taken by the IVth British Army are now estimated to total 19,000.
Early this morning the enemy made a local attack against our positions North of KEMMEL, but was repulsed after sharp fighting leaving some prisoners in our hands.
2.ITALIAN AND MACEDONIAN FRONTS. There is nothing of interest to report.
General Staff,
War Office, S.W.1.
11th August, 1918.
Issued at 12.35 p.m.
